channel.title: Pi npcs not spawning please help
channel.description: I've been trying out a pi source and it wont spawn any npcs or when I do ::npc it doesn't spawn please help ive done everything in spawn-config its not loading data and in bin PLEASE HELP!

item.title: Pi npcs not spawning please help
item.dc:creator: @imback4more imback4more
item.description:
@imback4more wrote:

If you’re compiler doesn’t have any errors,then type ::npc(id #) like
::npc1 or in some servers ::npc_1/::npc 1
Also try checking your command.java file to see what the command was named.Because when i opened my commands.java file instead of it saying

[code]if(playerCommand.startsWith(“npc”)) {
try {
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(4));
if(newNPC > 0) {
Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, newNPC, c.absX, c.absY, 0, 0, 120, 7, 70, 70, false, false);
c.sendMessage(“You spawn a Npc.”);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such NPC.”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

							}			
						} [/code]

The, if(playerCommand.startsWith(“npc”)) { . Npc was monster.And i was really freaking out why ::npc(id #) wouldn’t work and I found that it said monster instead

Read full topic
item.source: Pi npcs not spawning please help

item.title: Pi npcs not spawning please help
item.dc:creator: @Kristen1234 Kristen1234
item.description:
@Kristen1234 wrote:

First go source and data and cfg.

  1. Click spawn-config
  2. copy something like some other npc and paste it under that
  3. change that code in there like 1 into 66… or something u want to add
  4. then add x and y and 0 0 0 0 0 0 or add 0 0 0 1 or something do u want to move it or no…
  5. go back 2 times and compile
  6. go to your server
  7. YOURE DONE !

Read full topic
